faqs.question: How to test the new knowledge base upload feature?
faqs.answer:
To test the knowledge base upload:
1. Create a JSON file with knowledge base structure
2. Go to Admin Panel in the web app
3. Upload the file using the Knowledge Base Management section
4. The system will automatically merge it with existing knowledge
5. Test by asking questions covered in the uploaded content

faqs.question: What file formats are supported for knowledge base upload?
faqs.answer:
Knowledge base uploads support:
1. JSON files (.json extension)
2. Structure must include 'faqs' array for FAQ content
3. Optional sections: troubleshooting_guides, quick_solutions, emergency_contacts
4. Files are automatically backed up before replacement
5. Multiple files can be uploaded and will be merged automatically

faqs.question: How does the system handle duplicate knowledge base entries?
faqs.answer:
The system handles duplicates intelligently:
1. FAQs with the same ID are deduplicated automatically
2. Newer uploads take priority over older content
3. Different sections (troubleshooting_guides, quick_solutions) are merged
4. Backup files are created automatically before updates
5. Knowledge base is reloaded instantly after successful upload

quick_solutions.knowledge_upload: Go to Admin Panel → Knowledge Base Management → Upload JSON file
quick_solutions.test_knowledge: Upload test file, then ask questions covered in the content to verify
quick_solutions.backup_files: All uploads automatically create backup files with timestamps

upload_issues.title: Knowledge Base Upload Troubleshooting
steps: Verify JSON file is valid (use online JSON validator)
Check file has proper structure with 'faqs' array
Try refreshing the page if upload fails
Check browser console for error messages
Contact system administrator if issues persist
